1.text: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith, than an house full of sacrifices with strife.

2.text: A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causes shame, and shall have part of the inheritance among the brothers.

3.text: The fining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold: but the LORD tries the hearts.

4.text: A wicked doer gives heed to false lips; and a liar gives ear to a naughty tongue.

5.text: Whoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker: and he that is glad at calamities shall not be unpunished.

6.text: Childrenâ€™s children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

7.text: Excellent speech becomes not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince.

8.text: A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that has it: wherever it turns, it prospers.

9.text: He that covers a transgression seeks love; but he that repeats a matter separates very friends.

10.text: A reproof enters more into a wise man than an hundred stripes into a fool.

11.text: An evil man seeks only rebellion: therefore a cruel messenger shall be sent against him.

12.text: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man, rather than a fool in his folly.

13.text: Whoever rewards evil for good, evil shall not depart from his house.

14.text: The beginning of strife is as when one lets out water: therefore leave off contention, before it be meddled with.

15.text: He that justifies the wicked, and he that comdemns the just, even they both are abomination to the LORD.

16.text: Why is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom, seeing he has no heart to it?

17.text: A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for adversity.

18.text: A man void of understanding strikes hands, and becomes surety in the presence of his friend.

19.text: He loves transgression that loves strife: and he that exalts his gate seeks destruction.

20.text: He that has a fraudulent heart finds no good: and he that has a perverse tongue falls into mischief.

21.text: He that begets a fool does it to his sorrow: and the father of a fool has no joy.

22.text: A merry heart does good like a medicine: but a broken spirit dries the bones.

23.text: A wicked man takes a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.

24.text: Wisdom is before him that has understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.

25.text: A foolish son is a grief to his father, and bitterness to her that bore him.

26.text: Also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princes for equity.

27.text: He that has knowledge spares his words: and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.

28.text: Even a fool, when he holds his peace, is counted wise: and he that shuts his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
